alert.note: Alert for Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 10:29PM CDT until April 20 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR TRAVIS AND SOUTHEASTERN WILLIAMSON COUNTIES... At 1029 PM CDT, gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, with the highest amounts indicated over the upper reaches of Walnut Creek and Gilleland Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is likely ongoing, but should be shifting toward higher flows into the larger creeks and streams through 1045 PM CDT. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Austin, Round Rock, Cedar Park, Georgetown, Pflugerville, Taylor, Elgin, Granger, Windemere, Anderson Mill, Austin Bergstrom Int Airport, Hutto, Lakeway, Manor, Lago Vista, West Lake Hills, and Rollingwood. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
